definition: to be in a state of emergency/to report an emergency/to ask for emergency assistance
to say/to tell/to announce/to report/to denounce/to file a lawsuit/to sue

sentences.english: Over the weekend, premier Wen Jiabao visited drought-stricken areas, where a state of emergency was declared last week.
sentences.chinese: 温家宝总理于上周末视察上周告急的灾区。

sentences.english: The ship gave out radio signals for help.
sentences.chinese: 船发出无线电旌旗灯号告急。

sentences.english: In case of emergency, break the glass and press the button.
sentences.chinese: 遇到告急环境时，击碎玻璃罩并摁下按钮。

sentences.english: All of us were nervous and excited.
Sorry to bother you this late, but it's an emergency.
sentences.chinese: 着实抱歉这么晚还打电话打搅您，但是事变告急。

definition: in imminent peril (idiom)/on the brink of crisis
at top speed/at a tremendous lick
lit. as hurried as a shooting star (idiom); requiring immediate action/extremely urgent
precarious as pile of eggs (idiom); ready to fall and break at any moment/in a dangerous state
out of ammunition and no food left (idiom); in desperate straits
